title: BBC Local Live: Stoke & Staffordshire on Wednesday 4 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: stafford hospital deaths : trust faces sentencing .
290 more workers at staffordshire based jcb set to lose jobs .
laser used in attempted bus robbery in stoke .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for staffordshire and cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: watch : thousands of knitted poppies go on display in cheshire
text: thousands of poppies have been knitted to mark remembrance sunday in crewe .
they 've been put up in the town 's memorial square - after four years of planning .
author: Lamont Howie
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: football : 'global ' appeal of stoke 's game against chelsea
text: former stoke city winger terry conroy says the potter 's game against a stuttering chelsea side will have `` global appeal '' this weekend .
it 's because the under-pressure blues boss , jose mourinho , wo n't be at the britannia stadium as he serves a one match stadium ban .
the focus of the world is going to be on the britannia stadium is n't it ?
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: on midlands today this evening : stafford hospital deaths and jcb job cuts
text: two big staffordshire stories are among our main headlines tonight on bbc midlands today .
you 'll hear from families , speaking after the nhs trust that ran stafford hospital pleaded guilty today to criminal charges in relation to four deaths .
we 'll also be at the headquarters of jcb in staffordshire after the firm warned a further 290 jobs could be cut .
tune into midlands today on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: stafford hospital deaths : relatives speak after court appearance
text: some of the relatives of four people who died at stafford hospital have been speaking after the nhs trust that ran it today pleaded guilty to criminal charges .
one of the four , patrick daly , 89 , was admitted to hospital with diabetes but he died on 13 may 2014 after falling in a shower and fracturing his skull .
his wife catherine daly said doctors told her he had walked behind a member of staff into the shower and there had been no risk assessment .
the doctor told me he had three brain bleeds and he 's got as fractured skull and there 's not much we can do about it .
but i was with him when he was dying .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather watchers : what 's the weather like on your street ?
text: the bbc weather watchers website has started , allowing you to share what 's it like where you are .
the project launched on the one show last night .
create your own weather reports here
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : three lions cause burton postponement
text: burton albion 's league one game at home to millwall on saturday 14 november has been postponed because of international call-ups for three lions ' players
the match will be rescheduled for a date yet to be confirmed .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy , showery night and tomorrow
text: it 'll be mild and mostly cloudy overnight with some showery rain at times , although many places could remain dry .
low 10c ( 50f ) .
then tomorrow 's forecast is for a cloudy day with a few showers through the morning - high 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: latest headlines : nhs trust admits deaths charges , jcb plans more cuts and laser used in robbery attempt
text: staffordshire and cheshire 's main headlines this evening include :
a former nhs trust which ran stafford hospital will be sentenced next year , after pleading guilty today to criminal charges
- jcb 's chief executive says today 's decision to cut up to 290 more jobs was prompted by `` very tough trading conditions ''
- two men have tried to rob a bus in stoke-on-trent by shining a laser at the driver , police say
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: watch : war memorial turned red with knitting
text: villagers in the black county have come together to prepare for remembrance day in their own special way .
pelsall 's war memorial clock has been turned red , covered in more than 1,500 hand-knitted poppies .
author: David Lumb
BBC News Online

documents.title: jcb chief executive says outlook 'very challenging '
text: jcb 's chief executive says today 's decision to cut up to 290 more jobs was prompted by `` very tough trading conditions ''
these job losses are in addition to the 400 announced in september .

the firm said in the first six months of the year , the market in russia dropped by 70 % , in brazil by 36 % and by 47 % in china and parts of europe ; the uk and north america have also been affected .
as the global economy shows no sign of improving , the short-term outlook remains very challenging .
author: Caroline Gall
BBC News Online

documents.title: family heartbroken after vandals attack tamworth woman 's grave
text: a tamworth woman has been left devastated after her mother 's grave was vandalised this week .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: jobs could be hit by plans to close part of burton brewing operation
text: brewing giant molson coors has outlined proposals that could see part of its operation in burton close - in a move that could affect more than 60 employees .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: men brandishing laser try to rob bus in stoke-on-trent
text: two men have tried to rob a bus in stoke-on-trent by shining a laser at the driver , police say .
it was just after midnight on parkhall road , weston coyney say staffordshire police and the driver was forced to stop as he was `` temporarily blinded '' .
the force says a man armed with a knife then opened the door and demanded cash ' .
the driver accelerated then braked sharply , causing him to fall off .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: your sunlit pot bank in stoke-on-trent
text: this a pot bank - a remnant of stoke-on-trent 's ceramics heritage - was taken by leigh blunt who tweeted it to me .
like leigh , if you 've got a photo of staffordshire or cheshire to share , you can tweet it to @ twitterid
or use email or instagram ( just add # bbcstoke if you agree to share ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stafford hospital deaths : nhs trust admits 'very significant ' health and safety breaches
text: the nhs trust that ran stafford hospital has pleaded guilty to `` very significant '' health and safety breaches connected to the deaths of four elderly patients in its care .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: football : crewe may hang on to former leicester full-back
text: crewe alexandra are considering whether to offer a deal to on-trial defender zoumana bakayogo after almost two injury-hit years out of the game .
the 29-year-old ex-tranmere rovers and leicester city left-back has not played since rupturing his anterior cruciate ligament just 37 minutes into his debut on loan at yeovil in january 2014 .
we 're just providing him with the base to get himself going .
we 'll review it as we go along , at the moment i think he just needs more game time .
author: Graham McGarry
Crewe Alexandra commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: caffeine a factor in death of mum who drank eight litres of pepsi max a day , inquest hears
text: a mother-of-one 's love of pepsi max contributed to her death , an inquest has heard .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: hs2 : stoke-on-trent takes case for a station to government
text: staffordshire business leaders have headed to westminster today to lobby for hs2 to stop in stoke-on-trent .
they say it will be cheaper and faster for the high speed rail line to come through the city , rather than neighbouring cheshire .
the county 's chamber of commerce has taken local companies to meet ministers to push for a high speed station for the potteries .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: latest headlines : hundreds of jcb jobs at risk and hospital trust admits deaths charges
text: these are some of the main headlines this afternoon for staffordshire and cheshire :
- staffordshire-based jcb says another 290 jobs are at risk of redundancy
- the nhs trust which used to run stafford hospital has pleaded guilty to criminal charges in relation to the deaths of four patients
- thousands of poppies have been knitted to mark remembrance sunday in crewe
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: westbridge park m & s store to move a step closer
text: a planning application for a marks & spencer simply food store on westbridge park in stone will be submitted by the end of the year .
author: A Little Bit Of Stone

documents.title: your gorgeous potteries architecture
text: there is plenty of great architecture in staffordshire and cheshire as bbc radio stoke 's sarah robertson shows with this
it 's 1 albion street , stoke-on-trent , opposite the potteries museum and art gallery .
got a great of a building in the area ?
share it with me on email or tweet @ twitterid - i 'll feature as many as i can .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : could turn brighter this afternoon
text: there 's the chance of some brighter spells in places as the cloud breaks this afternoon .
high 12c ( 54f ) .
cloudy tonight with showers on the way tomorrow which could be heavy at times .
low 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: on midlands today this lunchtime : stafford hospital deaths court case
text: the nhs trust which ran stafford hospitalhas pleaded guilty to health and safety breachesrelated to the deaths of four elderly patients in its care .
the charges were brought by the health and safety executive against the now- defunct mid staffordshire nhs foundation trust .
i 'll have more on this storyon midlands today on bbc onefrom 13:30
author: Michele Paduano
Health correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: union says more planned jcb job cuts 'very disappointing '
text: a union says it 's working to try to minimise the impact of proposed jobs cuts at staffordshire digger maker jcb .
today the firm has announced 290 posts are at risk of redundancy - on top of the 400 it said last month could go .
our job as a trade union is to now work hard to formulate a plan to mitigate the impact of the proposed redundancies
author: Heidi Booth
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: police emergency numbers problem fixed
text: a problem with 999 and 101 calls in staffordshire has now been fixed , the police say .
staffordshire police says they are back to being received in their control room .
author: Alice Bentley
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds of jcb jobs at risk blamed on 'tough trading conditions
text: another 290 jobs are at risk of redundancy at jcb , the digger maker has announced .
back in september the firm said 400 positions could go and it says consultations over those redundancies continue .
now it 's also identified shop-floor roles which are under threat and a 45 day consultation period has begun on those with staff .

manufacturers in the construction equipment industry are currently facing very tough trading conditions and we have to react to the current market reality to protect the long-term future of the business .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : more jobs at risk at jcb and nhs trust to be sentenced over deaths
text: the top stories this lunchtime for staffordshire and cheshire include :
- staffordshire-based jcb says another 290 jobs are at risk of redundancy
- a former nhs trust which ran stafford hospital will be sentenced next year , after pleading guilty today to criminal charges .
- the emergency police phone numbers , 999 and 101 , are down in staffordshire , the force says
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: breakingmore jobs at risk of redundancy at jcb
text: staffordshire-based jcb says another 290 jobs are at risk of redundancy .
the digger maker is blaming the cuts on a drop in demand for its machines from overseas .
author: Terry Goodwin
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: police emergency numbers 999 and 101 out of action
text: the emergency police phone numbers , 999 and 101 , are down in staffordshire , the force says .
staffordshire police says it currently has a `` telephony fault '' and engineers are working to get them back as soon as possible .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : crash near leek affecting traffic
text: there 's been an accident on park lane near leek that 's affecting traffic both ways between the sutherland road and the hollow lane junctions .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stafford hospital deaths : four pensioners died
text: the health and safety executive says the criminal charges brought against the nhs trust that ran stafford hospital relate to four deaths .
- patrick daly , aged 89 , on 13 may 2014
- edith bourne , aged 83 , on 22 july 2013
- ivy bunn , aged 90 , on 6 november 2008
- lillian tucker , aged , 77 on 21 october 2005
this morning the now defunct mid staffordshire nhs foundation trust pleaded guilty and will be sentenced next year at stafford crown court .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: on air this morning : the best ways to rest and relax
text: is it a run in the park ?
do you prefer a day at the spa with a full facial and massage ?
i 'm talking relaxation today and what you do to switch off .
it 's because researchers are about to carry out a major worldwide study of rest in the 21st century as it 's crucial to our well being but not a lot is known about it .
so i want to know , how do you rest and relax ?
get involved on email or you can tweet @ twitterid
author: Perry Spiller
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: people told to use it or lose it over a staffordshire bus service
text: parents of pupils at a staffordshire moorlands school are urging as many people as possible to use a bus , to prove it pays for itself .
first bus took off the 8a service and it was claimed that meant that endon high pupils were getting to school too early or too late .
a petition was set up by people in brown edge , and now the service is back for a month 's trial .
author: Ros Chimes
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: stafford hospital deaths : nhs trust sentencing next year
text: a former nhs trust which ran stafford hospital will be sentenced next year , after pleading guilty today to criminal charges .
the health and safety executive brought the case against the mid staffordshire nhs foundation trust after four pensioners died , following breaches of health and safety guidelines .

stafford magistrates ' court heard that three of the deaths occurred after falls , while another took place after a patient was given penicillin , despite hospital staff being told she was allergic to the antibiotic .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: watch on tv again : the great pottery throw down
text: did you catch the great pottery throw down on bbc two last night which was filmed at middleport pottery in stoke-on-trent ?
you can see the programme for the next 29 days on the bbc iplayer .
and you 've been sending in your reaction on twitter
- dan said `` great programme , makes you appreciate skill and craft ''
- dimbleby ceramics tweeted : `` the trouble with watching # thegreatpotterythrowdown is my wife now want me to throw more bowls for the kitchen . ''
seeing great comments about the # potterythrowdown on @ twitterid - let us know what you think !
# greatpotterythrowdown
@ twitterid @ twitterid the trouble with watching # thegreatpotterythrowdown is my wife now want me to throw more bowls for the kitchen .
seeing great comments about the # potterythrowdown on @ twitterid - let us know what you think !
# greatpotterythrowdown
@ twitterid @ twitterid middleport pottery , a beautiful building , such pride in it .
great programme , makes you appreciate skill and craft .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid mrs t 's deindustrialisation of britain , and especially stoke- damage done- decay followed .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stafford hospital : mid-staffs trust pleads guilty over deaths
text: the trust which ran stafford hospital has pleaded guilty to criminal charges in connection with the deaths of four patients .
the mid staffordshire nhs foundation trust was dissolved last year after an inquiry found it was `` clinically and financially unsustainable '' .
the health and safety executive had raised a criminal case in connection with allegations of protocol breaches , in relation to the death of four patients at stafford hospital between 2005 and 2014 .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingnhs trust pleads guilty to criminal charges
text: the former mid-staffordshire nhs trust has pleaded guilty to criminal charges in relation to four deaths .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: latest headlines : court appearance for nhs trust today and nurse recruitment to tackle cheshire shortages
text: some of the top stories for staffordshire and cheshire this morning :
- the former mid-staffordshire nhs trust is due in court today to face criminal charges
- a hospital in south cheshire is looking to recruit more nurses because of worries that there 's a shortage
- staffordshire business leaders are heading to westminster today to lobby for hs2 to stop in stoke-on-trent
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: 'help police find who did this to me ' says beaten burglary victim
text: burglary victim ian alcock has told how he feared he would be killed by four masked men who stormed into his home during a terrifying late-night raid .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: travel warning : wide load heading out this morning in staffordshire
text: there 's a warning to drivers from staffordshire police this morning about a wide load on the roads .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
minor delays along a51 stone to hixon between 10am -11am today a wide load under escort
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stafford hospital : mid-staffs trust due in court over deaths
text: the former mid-staffordshire nhs trust is due in court today to face criminal charges .
the organisation was dissolved last year after an inquiry found it was `` clinically and financially unsustainable '' .
but the health and safety executive has raised a criminal case in connection with allegations of protocol breaches .
it 's in relation to the death of four patients at stafford hospital between 2005 and 2014 .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: campaign launched to make whole stretch of a38 a 60mph limit
text: police chiefs in burton have called for speed restrictions to be put in place across the whole stretch of the a38 in the area .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: your chimneys under autumn sky
text: `` autumn skies over leek '' is how dawn garrett described this she put on instagram to share with me .
if you 've got a great of staffordshire or cheshire , share it with me and i 'll feature as many as i can .
you can send them in on email or , like dawn , put them on instagram and add # bbcstoke to the description if you agree to share them
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : crash on a52 in stoke-on-trent
text: the a52 bucknall road in bucknall , stoke-on-trent is partially blocked eastbound because of an accident , at the b5040 dividy road junction - police are directing traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines : nhs trust due in court to face criminal charges and stoke protest over hs2 heads to westminster
text: staffordshire and cheshire 's main headlines this morning include :
- the nhs trust which used to run stafford hospital is due in court today to face criminal charges
- staffordshire business leaders are heading to westminster today to lobby for hs2 to stop in stoke-on-trent
- hospital bosses in staffordshire and cheshire are telling bbc radio stoke they 're concerned about how they 're going to recruit new nurses
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: weather : overcast and damp today
text: cloudy for much of the day with the risk of the odd shower here and there .
there 's the chance of some brighter spells in places as the cloud breaks this afternoon .
highs of 13-15c ( 55-59f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : a38 slow in south staffordshire
text: near lichfield , there 's slow traffic on the a38 southbound between streethay and lichfield .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stoke & staffordshire live : a wednesday welcome
text: good morning everyone , it 's looking still a bit misty overhead and a little damp - i took this in hanley of the town hall before 07:30 .
there 'll be a weather forecast shortly from alexandra hamilton and lee blakeman has the local headlines - plus we 'll have sport , travel , news and your
you can have your say and send in photos of staffordshire and cheshire by email , tweet @ twitterid or use instagram .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live
